column4: you might want to install ntfsprogs, then use ntfsfix on the partition that is giving you grief.

says /dev/sdb1 was processed successfully ... but still comes up with error 21:   i am convinced it is to do with my ubuntu installation as the usb drive works on my other ubuntu laptop and windows xp laptop
have you tried manually mounting it?
yeah it doesn't even output anything and just returns to the prompt
that is assuming the drive is /dev/sdb1, use the appropriate device
just tried what you said it just doesn't come back with anything
when i do a df it isn't mounted
i just tailed /var/log/syslog and tried to mount again and it doesn't even make an entry in the logs
tail -f /var/log/messages while plugging in the drive
i get all the usual "attached scsi ...." but there is an entry that says "[sdb] Test WP failed, assume Write Enabled"
